Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CD4-PP (cyclic dimeric KR-12 analog, synthetic AMPs, UCBB1)
Sequence Information.Source: designed, human cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature.Author: White JK, Muhammad T, Alsheim E, Mohanty S, Blasi-Romero A, Gunasekera S, Strömstedt AA, Ferraz N, Göransson U, Brauner A. 2022
Literature.Title: A stable cyclized antimicrobial peptide derived from LL-37 with host immunomodulatory effects and activity against uropathogens.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (81.82%) tocd4(Q5K,D9K)K=R: 19%, G: 16%, I: 13%. Designed by changing Q22 to K and D26 to A in KR-12 followed by connecting two copies of KR-12 with CPGG and GPGG.Activity: active against E. coli (MIC 0.312 uM) and P. aeruginosa (MIC 0.625 uM) in 10 mM tris buffer. Warning: other bacteria not tested.Structure: random coil in water and helical in lysoPG (78%).Peptide stability: CD4-PP gained stability to S. aureus protease aureolysin  (~20% detected after 6 h), while the control LL-37 was nearly completely degraded in 1 h.
